text_raw:
2. In these Regulations “Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness (Vehicle 
Testing) (No. 2) Regulations” means the Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness 
(Vehicle Testing) (No. 2) Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 347 of 2013).

title: Testing) (No. 2) Regulations” means the Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness
heading: 3. The Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness (Vehicle Testing) (No. 2)
text_raw:
3. The Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness (Vehicle Testing) (No. 2) 

Regulations are amended - 

(a) by the insertion of the following Regulations after Regulation 6: 

“6A. Notwithstanding Regulation 6 and 7 and subject 
to Regulation 6B, the test due date for a CVR vehicle of 
a class specified in column (2) of Schedule 1 at reference 
numbers 1 to 12 in column (1) of the Schedule shall be 
the date which is three months from each test due date 
in accordance with 
that vehicle determined 
for 
Regulation 6 or 7, as the case may be. 

to a CVR vehicle 
6B. Regulation 6A applies 
specified in column (2) of Schedule 1 at reference 
numbers 1 to 12 in column (1) of the Schedule, where - 

(a) 

the first test due date of the 
vehicle, determined in accordance 
with Regulation 6, falls during the 
period beginning on 28 March 
2020 and ending on 30 June 2020, 
or 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 24th April, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [133] 3 

(b) 

a certificate of roadworthiness in 
respect of the vehicle was in force 
on 28 March 2020.”, 

and 

(b) 

in Regulation 27, by the insertion of the following 
paragraph after paragraph (6): 

“(7) A certificate of roadworthiness issued 
under these Regulations, in respect of a CVR vehicle to 
which Regulation 6A applies, which is valid on 28 
March 2020 shall continue to be valid and the date of 
expiry of the certificate in respect of that vehicle 
(including the attached disc which relates to that 
certificate) shall be three months from the date of expiry 
specified on the certificate to be the date of its expiry.”. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [133] 

GIVEN under my Official Seal of the Minister for Transport, 
Tourism and Sport, 
20 April, 2020. 

SHANE ROSS, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [133] 5

title: Testing) (No. 2) Regulations” means the Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness (Vehicle 
Testing) (No. 2) Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 347 of 2013) to provide that a 3 
month extension is given to test due dates for CVR vehicles with a first test due 
falling during the period beginning on 28 March 2020 and ending on 30 June 
2020, or to CVR vehicles with a certificate of roadworthiness in force on 28 
March 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [133]
